{"rationale":"I organized the 8-week plan around the AZ-305 exam’s scenario-heavy design workflow and topic dependencies. Weeks 1–2 refresh design prerequisites (core architecture + Cloud Adoption Framework + Well-Architected Framework) so later decisions (identity/governance/monitoring, data, HA/DR) are made using the same frameworks and trade-off language used in the exam. Weeks 3–4 cover the full “Design identity, governance, and monitor solutions” domain with a built-in review day before the weekly checkpoint. Weeks 5–6 cover “Design data storage solutions” in the typical architect order: non-relational vs relational choices first, then integration patterns that connect services. Week 7 focuses on HA/DR concepts and then the concrete Azure design module for backup/DR, which is best learned after understanding core architecture and data choices. Week 8 is consolidation: spaced repetition, targeted weak-area review, and two timed scenario sets to validate readiness. Pacing is set to ~6 hours/week with six 60-minute sessions, leaving one day off per week and including at least one reinforcement/review session weekly to reduce forgetting and improve recall under
